Head Of Household.restrict: May not be the character's second lifepath.

Midwife.requires: Any female gender-specific lifepath (Lady, for example), Farmer or Itinerant Priest.

Elder.requires: The character must have at least 4 lifepaths and start the game over 50 years old.

Augur.requires: Midwife, Country Wife or must be female and character has no more than three lifepaths total.

Itinerant Priest.requires: Any Acolyte lifepath from any setting.

Recluse Wizard.requires: A previous lifepath that contains the sorcery skill.

Country Wife.note: A player who takes the Country Wife lifepath may also choose her husband's lifepath from the Peasant setting and may choose from his skills: she gets half of his skill points rounded down. She also receives half of her husband's resource points.

Kid.restrict: If chosen this must be the second lifepath and may only be taken once.

Miner.requires: Laborer, Conscript, Farmer or Foot Soldier.

Taskmaster.requires: Village Sergeant or any Soldier lifepath.

Hosteller.restrict: May not be the character's second lifepath.

Village Sergeant.requires: Village Guard, Squire, Freebooter, Sergeant-At-Arms or Man-At-Arms.

Corrupt Sergeant.requires: Village Guard, Squire, Freebooter, Sergeant-At-Arms or Man-At-Arms.

Tax Collector.restrict: May not be the character's second lifepath.

Venal Priest.requires: Acolyte, Clerk, Student or any Religious setting lifepath.

Vintner.restrict: May not be the character's second lifepath.

Merchant.requires: Accountant, Sea Captain, Shopkeeper, Smuggler, Fence, Vintner or Chamberlain

Village Wife.note: A player who takes the Village Wife lifepath may also choose her husband's lifepath from the Villager setting and may choose from his skills: she gets half of his skill points rounded down. She also receives half of her husband's resource points.

Urchin.restrict: If taken, must be the character's second or third lifepath.

Duelist.requires: Squire or any outcast or soldier lifepath or any guard lifepath.

Scholar.requires: Scribe, Thinker, Archivist, Interpreter, Custodian, Bishop or any sorcerous lifepath

Tax Collector.restrict: May not be the character's second lifepath.

Taskmaster.restrict: May not be the character's second lifepath

Sergeant-at-arms.requires: Any Guard lifepath, Marine, First Mate, Foot Soldier, Freebooter, Squire, Man-At-Arms, Cavalryman

Gaol Warden.requires: Born Noble, Merchant, Sergeant, Man-At-Arms or Judge

Hospital Warden.requires: Any Noble, Noble Court or Religious lifepath
requires_expr: noble court subsetting:advisor to the court

Banker.requires: Merchant, Moneylender, Steward, Accountant or Chamberlain

Merchant.requires: Master Craftsman, Master of Horses, Master of Hounds, Moneylender, Steward, Jeweler, Saddler, Armorer, Cobbler, Courtier or Chamberlain

Sorcerer.requires: Neophyte Sorcerer, Arcane Devotee or Weather Witch

Temple Priest.requires: Religious Acolyte, Temple Acolyte or Military Order

Judge.requires: Town Official, Tax Collector, Bailiff or Justicar

Municipal Minister.requires: Town Official, Scholar, Priest, Bishop, Captain, Sea Captain, Artisan, Master Craftsman, Knight, Courtier or Master of Horses

Artisan.requires: Apprentice Artisan, Engineer or Master Craftsman

Master Craftsman.requires: Journeyman and one of the following: Locksmith, Plumber, Engraver, Saddler, Blacksmith, Armorer, Atilliator, Cobbler, Bowyer or Taskmaster

Bishop.requires: Archpriest, Canon, Steward, Chamberlain or the Your Grace trait

City Wife.note: A player who takes the City Wife lifepath may also choose her husband's lifepath from the City Dweller setting and may choose from his skills: she gets half of his skill points rounded down. She also receives a quarter of her husband's resource points.

Bastard.restrict: This must be the character's second lifepath, and may only be taken once

Page.restrict: This must be the character's second lifepath, and may only be taken once

Squire.requires: Page or any Professional Soldier lifepath

Young Lady.restrict: This must be the character's second or third lifepath, and may only be taken once. Character must be female.

Lady.requires: Young Lady, Courtier, Knight or City Wife with Magnate or Bishop chosen as the husband's lifepath

Lord.requires: Knight or the Your Lordship trait

Dame.requires: Lady, City Wife with Magnate or Bishop as the husband's lifepath or the Your Lordship trait

Baron.requires: Knight and the Your Lordship trait; or Magnate, Master of Horses, Steward, Lord, Constable or Justicar

Viscount.requires: Knight and the Your Eminence trait; or Magnate, Baron, Constable or Justicar

Count.requires: Knight and the Your Eminence trait; or Magnate, Constable or Justicar

Duke.requires: Count or Knight and the Your Grace trait

Noble Prince.requires: Duke or Knight and the Your Grace trait

Prince Of The Blood.requires: The Your Grace trait and express permission from the GM and all players in the current game
Prince Of The Blood.note: Players may take the Prince of the Blood lifepath for any appropriate length of time, between 2 and 20 years.

Court Artist.requires: Court Jester, Painter, Thinker, Scholar or Sculptor

Page.restrict: This must be the character's second lifepath, and may only be taken once.

Man-at-arms.requires: Page, Squire or any Professional Soldier lifepath

Squire.requires: Corrupt Sergeant, Village Sergeant, Sergeant, Veteran, Page or Man-At-Arms

Young Lady.restrict: This must be the character's second or third lifepath, and may only be taken once. Character must be female.

traits: You Should Know Better Than That!
Governess.requires: Nurse, Midwife, Lady or any Wife lifepath

Chaplain.requires: Any Priest lifepath or Military Order

Court Sorcerer.requires: Arcane Devotee, Rogue Wizard or Sorcerer

Court Doctor.requires: Student, Itinerant Monk, Cloistered Monk/Nun or Priest

Chronicler.requires: Student, Custodian, Interpreter, Archivist or Young Lady

Steward.requires: Town Official, Municipal Minister, Judge, Court Lawyer, Court Doctor, Governess, Young Lady, Magnate or Lord

Master Of Horses.requires: Captain, Baron, Saddler, Merchant or Magnate

Master Of Hounds.requires: Captain, Baron, Saddler, Merchant or Magnate

Hostage.requires: Any lifepath from the Noble setting
Hostage.note: Hostage gives resource points equal to half of the character's previous lifepath.

Bailiff.requires: Knight or the Your Lordship trait

Coroner.requires: Steward, Town Official, Municipal Minister, Judge, Court Lawyer, Court Doctor, Magnate or Lord

Constable.requires: Captain, Baron, Viscount, Count, Duke or Prince

Treasurer.requires: Steward, Town Official, Municipal Minister, Judge, Court Lawyer, Court Doctor, Magnate, Baron, Bishop, Viscount, Count or Duke

Chamberlain.Requires: Scholar, Steward, Town Official, Municipal Minister, Judge, Court Lawyer, Court Doctor, Magnate, Baron, Bishop, Viscount, Count or Duke

Advisor To The Court.requires: Thinker, Captain, Sea Captain, Magnate, Master Craftsman, Artisan, Bishop, Rogue Wizard, Mad Summoner, Heretic Priest, Dame, Baron, Viscount, Count, Duke or Prince
Advisor To The Court.note: This lifepath can be one to three years long, player chooses tenure. Character earns 1 general skill point and 10 resource points per year. The stat and trait points are earned once.

Bondsman.note: The player may choose his Bondsman's owner's lifepath from the Noble, City Dweller, Soldier or Villager setting. The Bondsman may purchase from owner's skills with one quarter of that path's skill points (minimum of 1).

Urchin.restrict: Must be the second lifepath chosen and may only be taken once.

Fence.requires: Shopkeeper, Barkeep, Moneylender or an additional prior Outcast lifepath or criminal-type Lifepath from City Dweller

Whoremonger.requires: Corrupt Sergeant, Venal Priest, Shopkeeper, Barkeep, Moneylender or an additional prior Outcast lifepath or criminal-type lifepath from City Dweller

Freebooter.requires: Bandit, Smuggler, Squire, Knight, City Guard, Village Guard, Marine or any Professional Soldier lifepath

Strider.requires: Born Noble, Hunter, Trapper, Huntsman or Scout

Mad Summoner.requires: Cultist, Augur, Neophyte Sorcerer or Arcane Devotee

Rogue Wizard.requires: Cultist, Augur, Neophyte Sorcerer or Arcane Devotee

Crazy Witch.requires: Weather Witch, Young Lady, Augur or Midwife

Heretic Priest.requires: Acolyte, Cultist, Apostate, Theologian, Venal Priest, Interpreter or Archivist

Thinker.restrict: Thinker can only be taken if the character's starting age will be 36 years or older.

Sergeant.requires: Squire, Village Guard, City Guard or Foot Soldier

Veteran.requires: Sergeant, Sergeant-At-Arms, Knight, Military Order or Freebooter

Cavalryman.requires: A prior lifepath having to do with horses - Knight, Squire, Groom, Master of Horses, etc.

Chaplain.requires: Any Priest lifepath or Military Order

Engineer.requires: Student, Engineer, Mining Engineer or Artillerist's Mate

Wizard Of War.requires: Neophyte Sorcerer, Arcane Devotee, Weather Witch, Rogue Wizard or Mad Summoner

Quartermaster.requires: Sergeant, Veteran, Steward, Ship's Captain, Guard Captain, Merchant, Man-At-Arms, Smuggler, Constable or Lord

Captain.requires: Guard Captain, Knight, Lord, Constable or two Freebooter lifepaths

Boy.restrict: If chosen this must be the second lifepath and may only be taken once.

Crazy Old Sailor.requires: Sailor, Pirate or Mercenary Captain and that the character take this path sometime in his 40s

Ship's Doctor.requires: Doctor, Court Doctor, Physician, Barber or Student

traits: Secretly Worships The Black Sea God
Ship's Chaplain.requires: Chaplain, Military Order, Temple Acolyte or Religious Acolyte

Weather Witch.requires: Augur, Neophyte Sorcerer, Arcane Devotee or Rogue Wizard

Navigator.requires: Pilot, Mercenary Captain, Sailor or Student

traits: I Know This Ship Like My Own Hands

Engineer.requires: Artillerist's Mate, Student, Ship's Carpenter, Engineer or Journeyman

Officer's Mate.requires: Born Noble, Page or Son of a Gun
Officer's Mate.restrict: If chosen, this lifepath must be the character's second.

First Mate.requires: Knight or any two Sailor/Seafaring lifepaths

Ship's Captain.requires: First Mate, Knight, Military Order or two Mercenary Captain lifepaths

Military Order.requires: Squire, Knight or any lifepath from the Professional Soldier setting

Custodian.requires: Student, Young Lady, Cloistered Monk/Nun, Temple Acolyte, Inquisitor, Exorcist or Theologian

Interpreter.requires: Student, Young Lady, Temple Acolyte, Exorcist or Theologian

Archivist.requires: Student, Young Lady, Temple Acolyte, Exorcist or Theologian

Exorcist.requires: Temple Priest, Itinerant Priest, Priest, Court Priest or Archivist

Inquisitor.requires: Temple Priest, Itinerant Priest, Priest, Court Priest, Judge or Justicar

Theologian.requires: Scribe, Archivist, Court Lawyer, Advocate, Custodian, Interpreter, Priest or Bishop

Archpriest.requires: Temple Priest, Itinerant Priest, Priest, Court Priest or Chaplain

Abbot/abbess.requires: Itinerant Monk, Cloistered Monk/Nun, Theologian or Vintner

Bishop.requires: Archpriest, Baron, Viscount, Count, Duke or Prince and the Your Grace trait
